subject: AI
title: AI Landscape for Devs
description: A practical map of the AI ecosystem that matters for software developers.

hook.text: There are 10,000+ AI tools. A developer only needs to understand about 5 categories.

buildup.text: The landscape splits into foundation models, inference APIs, embedding services, orchestration frameworks, and deployment platforms.

discovery.text: Foundation models (GPT, Claude, Gemini) are the engines. APIs are the steering wheel. Frameworks like LangChain and LlamaIndex are the chassis.

twist.text: The landscape shifts monthly. The skill that matters isn't memorising tools â€” it's understanding the patterns they all share.

climax.text: Pick one model provider, one framework, and one deployment target. You can build 90% of AI features with just those three.

punchline.text: Knowing the map means you won't get lost when the next shiny tool drops.

quiz.question: Which is NOT one of the main AI ecosystem categories for developers?
